title: Neal Shapiro (equestrian)
text:
Neal Shapiro (born July 22, 1945) is an American <a href="equestrianism">equestrian</a> and Olympic medalist.
Career.
Shapiro was born in <a href="Brooklyn%2C%20New%20York">Brooklyn, New York</a>, and is Jewish.
He won silver and bronze medals in <a href="show%20jumping">show jumping</a> at the <a href="1972%20Summer%20Olympics">1972 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Munich">Munich</a>, Germany. He is also a two-time winner of the <a href="CHIO%20Aachen">Grand Prix of Aachen</a>. Shapiro was inducted into the <a href="United%20States%20Show%20Jumping%20Hall%20of%20Fame">United States Show Jumping Hall of Fame</a> in 2010.
He coached the 11-person U.S. equestrian team at the <a href="2013%20Maccabiah%20Games">19th Maccabiah Games</a> (the "Jewish Olympics") in Israel in 2013.
He is the cousin of historian <a href="Edward%20S.%20Shapiro">Edward S. Shapiro</a>.
